item.title: Timetable for WordPress sample 5
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Example 5. Timetable with filtering by event, dropdown menu for filtering, columns are days of the week, one hour measure, first hours column shown with ending hour, type 3 event block layout, 24 hour time format and non-clickable events. Go to example 1

[tt_timetable event='cardio-fitness,open-gym,body-building,zumba,boxing,crossfit' columns='sunday,monday,tuesday,wednesday,thursday,friday,saturday' show_end_hour='1' event_layout='3' box_bg_color='3156A3' box_hover_bg_color='42B3E5' box_hours_txt_color='A6C3FF' filter_color='3156A3' disable_event_url='1' text_align='left']

item.title: Timetable for WordPress sample 3
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Example 3. Timetable with filtering by event, tabs for filtering, columns are selected days of the week, one hour measure, first hours column hidden, rows without events hidden, type 3 event block layout, 12 hour time with custom separator and clickable events. Go to example 4

[tt_timetable event='power-fitness,martial-arts,body-works' columns='monday,tuesday,wednesday,thursday,saturday' filter_style='tabs' time_format='g.i a' hide_hours_column='1' event_layout='3' box_bg_color='2B363D' box_hover_bg_color='A13230' filter_color='D74340' hide_empty='1' text_align='left']

item.title: Timetable for WordPress sample 4
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Example 4. Timetable with filtering by category, dropdown menu for filtering, columns are different locations, half hour measure, first hours column hidden, type 4 event block layout with no ending hour, 24 hour time format, different font for table, custom CSS for event hour and non-clickable events. Go to example 5

[tt_timetable event_category='action,animation,catering,comedy,concert,horror,thriller' columns='bay-plaza-cinema,lakewood-cinema,north-park-theatre,old-capitol-arts,music-hall' measure='0.5' filter_kind='event_category' time_format='H:i' hide_hours_column='1' show_end_hour='1' event_layout='4' box_bg_color='DF4432' box_hover_bg_color='DF4432' filter_color='DF4432' disable_event_url='1' row_height='40' font='Open Sans:regular' font_subset='latin-ext' custom_css='.tt_timetable .hours {font-weight:400;font-size:24px;}']

item.title: Timetable for WordPress sample 2
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Example 2. Timetable with filtering by category, dropdown menu for filtering, columns are different locations, quarter hour measure, first hours column shown with no ending hour, type 1 event block layout, 24 hour time format, custom CSS for event header and non-clickable events. Go to example 3

[tt_timetable event_category='bar,display,panel,performance,registration,screening' columns='reception,floor-2,lounge-bar,floor-4,speakers-room,campus-green' measure='0.25' filter_kind='event_category' time_format='H:i' box_bg_color='96235B' filter_color='353C40' disable_event_url='1' custom_css='.tt_timetable .event .event_header {font-size:16px;font-weight:normal;}']

item.title: Timetable for WordPress
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Example 1. Timetable with filtering by event, dropdown menu for filtering, columns are days of the week, one hour measure, first hours column shown with no ending hour, type 1 event block layout, 12 hour time format and clickable events. Go to example 2

[tt_timetable event='body-building,boxing,cardio-fitness,crossfit,open-gym,zumba' columns='sunday,monday,tuesday,wednesday,thursday,friday,saturday' time_format='g:i a']

item.title: About
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row content_placement="middle" css=".vc_custom_1455945376982{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}" el_class="stm-row_table"][vc_column width="1/2" css=".vc_custom_1457152676290{padding-top: 0px !important;}" offset="vc_col-lg-6 vc_col-md-6"][stm_spacing xs_spacing="80px"][stm_single_image img_alignment="right" img_id="3270" img_size="410x648"][stm_wp_custommenu nav_menu="stm-about" position="absolute" position_top="80px" position_left="0" hidden_xs="true"][stm_spacing xs_spacing="40px"][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/12" css=".vc_custom_1457152662097{padding-right: 12px !important;padding-left: 12px !important;}" offset="vc_col-lg-1 vc_hidden-md vc_hidden-sm vc_hidden-xs"][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/2" offset="vc_col-lg-5 vc_col-md-6"][stm_spacing sm_spacing="80px"][stm_title title_tag="h2" title="Principals Welcome" sep_enable="true" sep_css="margin-bottom:51px;" sep_margin_b="51px"][/stm_title][stm_testimonials stm_testimonial_type="single_static" testimonial_text=" " testimonial_cite="Mrs Joanna McQuaid, Principal" cite="Mrs Joanna McQuaid, Principal" enable_cite_customization="true" cite_space_top="30px"]As Principal I wish you a very warm welcome to Our School! We are at the heart of the London community and in 2010 we have succeeded in providing local families an excellent education delivered by exceptional teachers in award winning facilities. Judged as a good school by Ofsted our achievements can be seen through rapid improvements in education. We are also making key strides towards creating an school which makes a significant difference to the community we serve and that provides opportunities for all our pupils and students.[/stm_testimonials][stm_spacing sm_spacing="80px" xs_spacing="80px"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row full_width="stretch_row" css=".vc_custom_1455945582302{margin-bottom: 0px !important;padding-top: 38px !important;padding-bottom: 59px !important;background-color: #ffffff !important;}"][vc_column offset="vc_col-lg-8 vc_col-md-7"][stm_title title_tag="h3" title="Mission" sep_enable="true" sep_margin_b="41px"][/stm_title][vc_column_text]Secondary School was founded in 1987 to provide students with excellent academic programs and a nurturing environment with close student-teacher relationships. Secondary School is a private yet affordable elementary school offering a stimulating curriculum and a supportive environment to ensure our students experience success every day.[/vc_column_text][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/2"][vc_column_text]
  • Secondary School was founded in 1987
  • Students with excellent academic programs
  • Stimulating curriculum and a supportive environment
[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/2"][vc_column_text]

  • Students experience success every day
  • Supportive environment to ensure

item.title: About our School
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: [vc_row full_width="stretch_row" css=".vc_custom_1455945184511{background-color: #ffffff !important;background-position: 0 0 !important;background-repeat: no-repeat !important;}"][vc_column offset="vc_col-lg-4 vc_col-md-4"][stm_spacing lg_spacing="36px" md_spacing="10px"][vc_column_text]Secondary School is a private yet affordable elementary school offering a stimulating curriculum and a supportive environment to ensure our students experience success every day. We focus on scholastic development, personal growth, and ethical enrichment. The result: students who are independent and confident, inquisitive and enthusiastic, responsible and compassionate. We believe the elementary school years are the most formative of a childs life. These early years can breed intellectual apathy or curiosity to seek knowledge.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/2" offset="vc_col-lg-4 vc_col-md-4"][stm_spacing lg_spacing="36px" md_spacing="10px"][stm_blockquote cite="Joanna McQuaid, Director / Owner" footer_space_t="60px"]A time marked by creative, social, and emotional development, and characterized by a lifelong love of learning and the joys of new, diverse friendships. Secondary School was founded in 1987 to provide students with excellent academic programs and a nurturing environment with close student-teacher relationships. Secondary School prepares students or success both personally and academically.[/stm_blockquote][stm_spacing xs_spacing="40px"][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/2" css=".vc_custom_1457088176282{margin-bottom: 0px !important;padding-top: 0px !important;}" offset="vc_col-lg-4 vc_col-md-4"][stm_single_image img_id="3270" img_size="755x562"][stm_spacing xs_spacing="80px"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row full_width="stretch_row" css=".vc_custom_1459850953652{margin-bottom: 66px !important;padding-top: 38px !important;padding-bottom: 22px !important;background-color: #f8f8f8 !important;}"][vc_column][stm_title title_tag="h2" sep_color="pistachio" title="Certifications" sep_enable="true" sep_css="margin-bottom:50px;" sep_line_css="width:60px;height:2px;" title_font="font-weight:300;" title_margin="margin-bottom:50px;" sep_margin_b="50px"][/stm_title][stm_achievement posts_count="6" certifications="true" stm_cat_certifications="true"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row full_width="stretch_row_content_no_spaces" css=".vc_custom_1449663544439{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"][vc_column css=".vc_custom_1451042945600{padding-top: 0px !important;}"][stm_gallery][/vc_column][/vc_row]

item.title: Meet our Teachers
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row css=".vc_custom_1459860808928{padding-top: 80px !important;padding-bottom: 71px !important;}"][vc_column width="1/3" offset="vc_col-lg-3 vc_col-md-4 vc_col-xs-12 vc_hidden-xs"][stm_wp_custommenu nav_menu="stm-about" css=".vc_custom_1464413698232{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"][stm_spacing xs_spacing="35px" sm_spacing="40px"][/vc_column][vc_column width="2/3" offset="vc_col-lg-9 vc_col-md-8 vc_col-xs-12"][stm_title title_tag="h2" subtitle_color="dark-gray" title="Teaching Staff" sep_enable="true" subtitle_enable="true" subtitle_font_size="16px" subtitle_margin_b="0px"]Mrs Joanna McQuaid was named Secondary Schools seventh principal in 1994. She was formerly the Neil A. Armstrong Distinguished Professor of Aeronautics and Astronautics at Purdue University, where she also served as the dean of engineering for ten years. Dr. McQuaid is a member of the National Academy of Engineering and a Fellow of the American Institute of Aeronautics and Astronautics, the American Society for Engineering Education, and the American Society of Mechanical Engineers. She has received a number of recognitions for her research, teaching, and public service, including seven honorary doctorates and the Benjamin Garver Lamme Medal from the American Society of Engineering Education. In 2008 she received the Structures, Structural Dynamics, and Materials Award from the American Institute of Aeronautics and Astronautics.[/stm_title][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row full_width="stretch_row" css=".vc_custom_1455947018263{padding-top: 45px !important;padding-bottom: 40px !important;background-color: #ffffff !important;}"][vc_column][stm_teachers count="6"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row css=".vc_custom_1455947038126{padding-top: 38px !important;padding-bottom: 89px !important;}"][vc_column offset="vc_col-lg-8 vc_col-md-8"][stm_title title_tag="h3" title="Senior Leadership Team" sep_enable="true" sep_margin_b="50px"][/stm_title][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1451968765582{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
Title Name Qualifications
Principal Mrs J. McQuaid BSc (Hons)
Vice Principal Mrs S. Monk BEd
Vice Principal Mr S. McGuinness BSc (Hons), NPQH, PGDip (Ed)
Chief Operating Officer School's Multi-Academy Trust Mr S. Beeson BA (Hons), FCCA
Assistant Vice Principal Mr D. Bannister BA (Hons)
Head of Sixth Form Miss J. Armstrong BSc (Hons)
Assistant Vice Principal Mr N. Giles BEc, MA
[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column offset="vc_col-lg-4 vc_col-md-4"][stm_title title_tag="h3" title="FAQ" sep_enable="true" sep_margin_b="50px"][/stm_title][vc_tta_accordion gap="4" c_position="right" active_section="1" style="outline" shape="square" color="sky"][vc_tta_section title="Jack Petchey Awards Evening?" tab_id="1451476878677-6ddc75ec-51a1"][vc_column_text]Private yet affordable elementary school offering a stimulating curriculum and a supportive environment.[/vc_column_text][/vc_tta_section][vc_tta_section title="Holocaust Survivor visits our school?" tab_id="1451476902842-f2d4696e-a412"][vc_column_text]Private yet affordable elementary school offering a stimulating curriculum and a supportive environment.[/vc_column_text][/vc_tta_section][vc_tta_section title="Children in Need Armistice Day?" tab_id="1451476912364-89c94fe3-8b72"][vc_column_text]Private yet affordable elementary school offering a stimulating curriculum and a supportive environment.[/vc_column_text][/vc_tta_section][/vc_tta_accordion][/vc_column][/vc_row]

item.title: Cafeteria
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row][vc_column width="5/12" offset="vc_col-lg-3 vc_col-md-3 vc_hidden-xs"][stm_spacing lg_spacing="80px" md_spacing="80px" sm_spacing="80px"][stm_wp_custommenu nav_menu="stm-about" css=".vc_custom_1464413757090{margin-left: -15px !important;}"][/vc_column][vc_column width="7/12" offset="vc_col-lg-6 vc_col-md-6"][stm_spacing lg_spacing="80px" md_spacing="80px" sm_spacing="80px" xs_spacing="80px"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1452076739183{margin-top: -10px !important;margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]Full time General Service Manager on site, is responsible for all catering and domestic services within the school. A wide selection of freshly made dishes is available from the Dining Hall at breakfast, lunch and dinner, with a salad bar always offered at lunch and dinner time along with hot and cold vegetarian options.
Our Managers and Chefs are trained using their own specific training course, so that they understand the company philosophy to produce a food standard that can't be bettered; offering healthy eating with a balance between current eating trends, good nutrition and fresh home-cooked food.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column offset="vc_col-lg-3 vc_col-md-3"][stm_spacing sm_spacing="40px" xs_spacing="40px"][stm_single_image img_id="3270" img_size="725x503"][stm_spacing xs_spacing="80px" sm_spacing="80px"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row full_width="stretch_row" css=".vc_custom_1455856130388{padding-top: 38px !important;padding-bottom: 100px !important;background-color: #ffffff !important;background-position: 0 0 !important;background-repeat: no-repeat !important;}"][vc_column][stm_title title_tag="h2" sep_color="green" title="Menu" sep_enable="true" sep_margin_b="32px"][/stm_title][stm_meal items_count="2"][/vc_column][/vc_row]

item.title: Typography
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row css=".vc_custom_1459859749480{padding-top: 80px !important;}"][vc_column width="1/2"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1453352019009{margin-bottom: 33px !important;}"]

H1 Lato Light, 42px

[/vc_column_text][stm_separator border_color="green" sep_line_width="60px"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1453352991458{margin-bottom: 66px !important;}"]Welcome back to your school. We hope you enjoy being a part of our extended international community that brings together former Secondary School students, parents and staff from around the world. If you are not yet an School Alumni member, register today through the Alumni Community section and reconnect with a global network that just keeps growing.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/2"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1453352169453{margin-bottom: 34px !important;}"]

H2 Lato Light, 36px

[/vc_column_text][stm_separator border_color="green" sep_line_width="60px"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1453352999291{margin-bottom: 66px !important;}"]We are share our recent Independent Schools Inspectorate Report a big congratulations to our students, staff, and parents for making us an 'excellent' place to learn, work, and collaborate. Our 'high quality curriculum' and the 'wide range' of extra curricular activities have been highlighted as areas where our students have shown 'excellent levels of knowledge and skills'.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column width="1/2"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1453352413478{margin-bottom: 35px !important;}"]

H3 Lato Light, 30px

[/vc_column_text][stm_separator border_color="green" sep_line_width="60px"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1453353057134{margin-bottom: 70px !important;}"]Secondary School is currently looking for candidates to join our international community in a number of roles including teaching, IT and maintenance. More information on available positions, job descriptions and benefits can be found on our website at: www.stylemixthemes.com/vacancies.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/2"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1453352470759{margin-bottom: 36px !important;}"]

H4 Lato Light, 24px

[/vc_column_text][stm_separator border_color="green" sep_line_width="60px"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1453353067171{margin-bottom: 70px !important;}"]Throughout the year, students have continued to build a repertoire of performance pieces to include a variety of music and dance styles. Students continue to showcase their work during school assemblies and whole Secondary School events.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column width="1/2"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1453352654127{margin-bottom: 27px !important;}"]

[/vc_column_text][stm_separator border_color="green" css=".vc_custom_1456478861745{margin-bottom: 31px !important;}" sep_line_width="60px"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1453353661560{margin-bottom: 71px !important;}"]Students from Secondary School MHS Band and the Secondary School Dance Team performed various songs and dance pieces during the 'Express Yourself' Dance & Music Event held at Secondary School on 9 December 2015.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/2"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1453352697607{margin-bottom: 28px !important;}"]

More information on available positions, job descriptions and benefits can be found on our website at: www.stylemixthemes.com/vacancies.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/2"][vc_column_text]Congratulations to our students, staff and parents for making us an 'excellent' place to learn, work, and collaborate. Our 'high quality curriculum' and the 'wide range' of extra curricular activities have been highlighted as areas where our students have shown 'excellent levels of knowledge and skills'.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]

Three columns

[/vc_column_text][stm_separator sep_line_width="60px"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row css=".vc_custom_1453459964368{margin-bottom: 30px !important;}"][vc_column width="1/3"][vc_column_text]Throughout the year, students have continued to build a repertoire of performance pieces to include a variety of music and dance styles, students continue to showcase their work.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/3"][vc_column_text]Secondary School is currently looking for candidates to join our international community in a number of roles including teaching, IT and maintenance.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/3"][vc_column_text]Our 'high quality curriculum' and the 'wide range' of extra curricular activities have been highlighted as areas where our students have shown 'excellent levels of knowledge and skills'.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]

Four columns

[/vc_column_text][stm_separator sep_line_width="60px"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row css=".vc_custom_1453460417205{margin-bottom: 33px !important;}"][vc_column width="1/4"][vc_column_text]To build a repertoire of performance pieces to include a variety of music and dance styles, students continue to showcase their work.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/4"][vc_column_text]A big congratulations to our students, staff, and parents for making us an 'excellent' place to learn, work, and collaborate.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/4"][vc_column_text]Extra curricular activities have been highlighted as areas where our students have shown 'excellent levels of knowledge and skills'.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/4"][vc_column_text]Currently looking for candidates to join our international community in a number of roles including teaching, IT and maintenance.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]

Custom layout 3/4 + 1/4

[/vc_column_text][stm_separator sep_line_width="60px"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row css=".vc_custom_1453461446393{padding-bottom: 59px !important;}"][vc_column width="3/4"][vc_column_text]With schools in London, England, Secondary Schools' curriculum includes the International Baccalaureate (IB) Programmes, and an American curriculum including Advanced Placement (AP) courses. Students from Secondary School MHS Band and the Secondary School Dance Team performed various songs and dance pieces during the 'Express Yourself' Dance & Music Event held at Secondary School on 9 December 2015.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/4"][vc_column_text]Throughout the year, students have continued to build a repertoire of performance pieces to include a variety of music and dance styles.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row]

item.title: Classes
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row css=".vc_custom_1459860914508{margin-bottom: 100px !important;padding-top: 80px !important;}"][vc_column offset="vc_col-lg-7 vc_col-md-7"][stm_title title_tag="h2" sep_color="green" title="Academic Year 2015-2016" sep_enable="true" sep_margin_b="50px"][/stm_title][stm_courses][vc_column_text]From 10 faculty members, 40 students and three fields of study at the time of its founding, Secondary School has grown to more than 1,600 faculty, 35,000 students and over 350 degree programs in 130 academic departments and 80 interdisciplinary research units. One of the most important things we can do for students is not just teach them specific knowledge and skills, but help them match their interests to their career path. Secondary School has grown to more than 1,600 faculty, 35,000 students and over 350 degree programs in 130 academic departments and 80 interdisciplinary research units. We can do for students is not just teach them specific knowledge and skills, but help them match their interests to their career path.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column offset="vc_col-lg-5 vc_col-md-5"][stm_title title_tag="h3" sep_color="green" title="Important Dates" sep_enable="true" sep_margin_b="50px" title_margin_t="6px"][/stm_title][stm_events view_style="list" events_count="1"][stm_btn_simple btn_icon_position="right" btn_link="url:http%3A%2F%2Fsmartyschool.stylemixthemes.com%2Facademic-calendar%2F||" btn_link_text="Full Academic Calendar" btn_icon_enable="true" btn_margin_b="60px"][stm_text_box title_tag="h3" sep_color="custom" title_color="custom" stm_bg_color="green" title="Related Information" sep_enable="true" sep_color_custom="#ffffff" title_color_custom="#ffffff"]

item.content:encoded:
[vc_row css=".vc_custom_1459860935886{margin-bottom: 0px !important;padding-top: 80px !important;padding-bottom: 38px !important;}"][vc_column][stm_title title_tag="h2" sep_color="green" title="Graduate Courses for the 20152016 Academic Year" sep_enable="true" sep_margin_b="45px"][/stm_title][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/3"][stm_title title_tag="h4" sep_position="right" title="Fall 2015 Courses" sep_enable="true" title_margin_b="29px"][/stm_title][vc_column_text]

item.content:encoded:
[vc_row css=".vc_custom_1459859399026{padding-top: 80px !important;}"][vc_column][stm_title title_tag="h2" title_align="center" subtitle_color="dark-gray" sep_color="green" title="Admissions Process" sep_enable="true" subtitle_enable="true" subtitle_font_size="18px" subtitle_margin_b="43px" sep_margin_b="52px"]We are currently accepting applications for Grades 4 through 10 for the 201617 academic year.[/stm_title][vc_row_inner css=".vc_custom_1455093758686{padding-bottom: 60px !important;}"][vc_column_inner offset="vc_col-lg-4 vc_col-md-4"][stm_icon_box view_style="style-4" icon_type="svg" icon_position="left" icon_color="green" title="Request Info" descr="You will receive a confirmation email with login, password and instructions needed to our online application." button_enable="true" step_enable="true" step_number="1" step_number_size="120px" step_number_color="#f8f8f8" button_text="Request Info" button_link="url:%23||" icon_size="61px" css=".vc_custom_1457102880025{margin-right: -10px !important;margin-bottom: 30px !important;}" svg_id="2833" svg_animated="true"][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner offset="vc_col-lg-4 vc_col-md-4"][stm_icon_box view_style="style-4" icon_type="svg" icon_position="left" icon_color="green" title="Apply" descr="After October 1, you may login and complete your online application using the credentials emailed to you." button_enable="true" step_enable="true" step_number="2" step_number_color="#f8f8f8" button_text="Apply Online" button_link="url:%23||" icon_size="61px" css=".vc_custom_1457102888645{margin-right: -5px !important;margin-bottom: 30px !important;margin-left: -5px !important;}" svg_id="2835" svg_animated="true"][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner offset="vc_col-lg-4 vc_col-md-4"][stm_icon_box view_style="style-4" icon_type="svg" icon_position="left" icon_color="green" title="Submit" descr="Enter payment information and $100.00 application fee. The form is submitted, you will receive an email confirmation." button_enable="true" step_enable="true" step_number="3" step_number_color="#f8f8f8" button_text="Submit Form" button_link="url:%23||" icon_size="61px" css=".vc_custom_1457102898022{margin-left: -10px !important;}" svg_id="2836" svg_animated="true"][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row full_width="stretch_row" css=".vc_custom_1455094182246{padding-top: 38px !important;padding-bottom: 36px !important;background-color: #ffffff !important;}"][vc_column][stm_title title_tag="h2" sep_color="green" title="Eligibility" sep_enable="true"][/stm_title][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/2" offset="vc_col-lg-5 vc_col-md-5"][stm_title title_tag="h4" title_font_weight="400" title="Academic Standing" title_margin_b="37px"][/stm_title][vc_column_text]You will receive a confirmation email with login code, password, and instructions needed to complete our online application. By mail, you will also receive an admissions packet with additional materials including video instructions You will receive a confirmation email with login code, password, and instructions needed to complete our online application. By mail, you will also receive an admissions packet with additional materials including video instructions[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/2" offset="vc_col-lg-4 vc_col-md-4"][stm_title title_tag="h4" title_font_weight="400" title="Extracurricular Activities" title_margin_b="37px"][/stm_title][vc_column_text]After October 1, you may login and complete your online application using the credentials sent to your email:
  • Online application will be available after October 1, 2015
  • Deadline: January 15, 2016 for grades 910
  • Deadline: January 22, 2016 for grades 48

The collaborative experience of pursuing and attaining a common goal in athletics is unique, as it is combined with interscholastic competition. We are proud of our winning tradition. Through this experience, our students are able to develop courage as they take risks, strength while displaying finesse, competitive intensity while exhibiting generosity of spirit, and mental as well vc_col-xs-12"][stm_title title_tag="h4" sep_color="green" title="Lorem ipsum" sep_enable="true"][/stm_title][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1455113976063{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]Secondary School's proud tradition of athletics is reflected in the beauty and function of its campus facilities, the Haraldur Athletic Complex and Hopkins Gymnasium. Ford Athletic Field, complete with digital scoreboards, allows Athletics lacrosse, soccer, and softball teams to host games on regulation fields; CIF-SS regulation-sized Hopkins Gymnasium is home court for basketball and volleyball. Secondary school athletes also benefit from use of the Rosenbaum Family Weight Training Room, a facility designed specifically for our students.[/vc_column_text][stm_spacing xs_spacing="40px" sm_spacing="40px"][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner offset="vc_col-lg-6 vc_col-md-6 vc_col-xs-12"][stm_single_image img_id="3270" img_size="540x392" img_responsive_enable="true"][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][/vc_tta_section][/vc_tta_tabs][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row css=".vc_custom_1455183754787{padding-top: 38px !important;padding-bottom: 100px !important;}" el_id="resources"][vc_column][stm_title title_tag="h2" sep_color="green" title="Athletic Resources" sep_enable="true"][/stm_title][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner offset="vc_col-lg-9 vc_col-md-9 vc_col-xs-12"][stm_title title_tag="h4" title="School Athletic Trainer" title_margin_b="24px"][/stm_title][stm_teacher_bio img_id="3270" title="John Appleseed," position="ATC, CPT"]John is a Certified Athletic Trainer, Certified Personal Trainer, and Health and Safety Specialist offering a strong background in injury care, prevention, rehabilitation, health promotion and wellness. John has an enduring passion for continuous education and has intentionally engaged in various work experiences for a well-rounded scope on healthcare. Johns primary interests include nutrition and biomechanics, with a concentrated focus on improving performance. For injury prevention, diagnosis, or treatment information, please email John at jappleseed@stylemixthemes.com.[/stm_teacher_bio][stm_spacing xs_spacing="45px" sm_spacing="45px"][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner offset="vc_col-lg-3 vc_col-md-3 vc_col-xs-12"][stm_single_image img_id="3270" img_size="181x265" img_responsive_enable="true" css=".vc_custom_1460722644398{margin-bottom: 16px !important;}"][stm_btn_simple btn_size="size-custom" btn_icon_position="right" btn_icon_size="5px" btn_icon_hspace="6px" btn_link="url:%23||" btn_link_text="Download Guidebook" btn_custom_text_size="13px" btn_custom_height="36px" btn_custom_padd_l="19px" btn_custom_padd_r="16px" btn_icon_enable="true"][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][/vc_column][/vc_row]

item.title: Academics
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row][vc_column width="1/2" offset="vc_col-xs-12"][stm_spacing xs_spacing="80px"][stm_single_image img_alignment="right" img_id="3270" css=".vc_custom_1460722316234{margin-right: 35px !important;}" img_size="910x483"][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/2" offset="vc_col-xs-12"][stm_spacing lg_spacing="73px" md_spacing="73px" sm_spacing="30px" xs_spacing="30px"][stm_title title_tag="h2" sep_color="green" title="Different Directions" sep_enable="true"][/stm_title][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1455185545032{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]From 10 faculty members, 40 students and three fields of study at the time of its founding, Secondary School has grown to more than 1,600 faculty, 35,000 students and over 350 degree programs in 130 academic departments and 80 interdisciplinary research units. One of the most important things we can do for students is not just teach them specific knowledge and skills, but help them match their interests to their career path.[/vc_column_text][stm_spacing xs_spacing="80px"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row full_width="stretch_row" css=".vc_custom_1455192302689{padding-top: 45px !important;padding-bottom: 100px !important;background-color: #ffffff !important;}"][vc_column offset="vc_col-lg-7 vc_col-md-6 vc_col-xs-12"][stm_image_box sep_color="green" title="Departments and degree programs" img_id="3270" sep_enable="true" title_link="url:%23||" css=".vc_custom_1455734118958{margin-bottom: 40px !important;}"]Our School's academic enterprise is organized into 14 primary and secondary schools.[/stm_image_box][stm_image_box sep_color="green" title="Courses schedule" img_id="3270" sep_enable="true" title_link="url:http%3A%2F%2Fsmartyschool.stylemixthemes.com%2Fcourse-schedule%2F||" css=".vc_custom_1455734125635{margin-bottom: 40px !important;}"]Secondary School offers over 350 degree programs through its academic departments. Search with our A to Z guide.[/stm_image_box][stm_image_box sep_color="green" title="Classes" img_id="3270" sep_enable="true" title_link="url:http%3A%2F%2Fsmartyschool.stylemixthemes.com%2Fclasses%2F||" css=".vc_custom_1455734132952{margin-bottom: 40px !important;}"]Planning your schedule? Search available courses in everything from aerospace studies to vision science.[/stm_image_box][stm_image_box sep_color="green" title="Academic Calendar" img_id="3270" sep_enable="true" title_link="url:http%3A%2F%2Fsmartyschool.stylemixthemes.com%2Facademic-calendar%2F||" css=".vc_custom_1455734141062{margin-bottom: 40px !important;}"]From study strategies to planning for grad school or beyond, find the resources you need to succeed at Secondary School.[/stm_image_box][stm_image_box sep_color="green" title="Library" img_id="3270" sep_enable="true" title_link="url:%23||"]Find faculty interests and areas of expertise in this searchable index of our secondary school.[/stm_image_box][/vc_column][vc_column offset="vc_col-lg-5 vc_col-md-6 vc_col-xs-12"][stm_title title_tag="h3" sep_color="green" title="Important Dates" sep_enable="true" sep_margin_b="50px" title_margin_t="-6px"][/stm_title][stm_events view_style="list" events_count="1"][stm_btn_simple btn_icon_position="right" btn_link="url:http%3A%2F%2Fsmartyschool.stylemixthemes.com%2Facademic-calendar%2F||" btn_link_text="Full Academic Calendar" btn_icon_enable="true" btn_margin_b="60px"][stm_text_box title_tag="h3" sep_color="custom" title_color="custom" stm_bg_color="green" title="Related Information" sep_enable="true" sep_color_custom="#ffffff" title_color_custom="#ffffff"]

item.title: Alumni
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: [vc_row css=".vc_custom_1460722558111{padding-top: 80px !important;padding-bottom: 80px !important;}"][vc_column offset="vc_col-lg-6 vc_col-md-6"][stm_title title_tag="h2" sep_color="green" title="Welcome to School Alumni!" sep_enable="true"][/stm_title][stm_blockquote cite="Mrs. Abigail Thompson, Alumni Relations Coordinator" footer_space_t="35px"]Welcome back to your school! We hope you enjoy being a part of our extended international community that brings together former Secondary School students, parents and staff from around the world. If you are not yet an Secondary School Alumni member, register today through the Alumni Community section and reconnect with a global network that just keeps growing. We look foward to hearing from you. With best wishes,[/stm_blockquote][stm_spacing sm_spacing="45px" xs_spacing="45px"][/vc_column][vc_column offset="vc_col-lg-6 vc_col-md-6"][stm_single_image img_id="3270" img_size="570x380" img_responsive_enable="true"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row full_width="stretch_row" css=".vc_custom_1455265528810{padding-top: 45px !important;padding-bottom: 60px !important;background-color: #ffffff !important;}"][vc_column offset="vc_col-lg-7 vc_col-md-7 vc_col-xs-12"][stm_title title_tag="h2" sep_color="green" title="Strengthening Relationships" sep_enable="true" sep_margin_b="60px"][/stm_title][stm_slider css=".vc_custom_1455265547432{margin-bottom: 30px !important;}"][stm_slider_item img_id="3270" img_size="635x450"][stm_slider_item img_id="3270" img_size="635x450"][/stm_slider][/vc_column][vc_column css=".vc_custom_1457022817106{padding-left: 30px !important;}" offset="vc_col-lg-5 vc_col-md-5 vc_col-xs-12"][stm_text_box button_color_scheme="white" button_position="right" title_color="custom" text_color="custom" stm_bg_color="green" button_text="View our Network" button_link="url:%23||" title_color_custom="#ffffff" padding_top="61px" padding_right="60px" padding_bottom="50px" padding_left="95px" css=".vc_custom_1457023491273{margin-bottom: 43px !important;margin-left: -85px !important;}" text_color_custom="#ffffff" text_font_size="16px" text_line_height="36px" text_margin_b="24px"]We aim to strengthen relationships between School alumnae, students, and soon-to-be alumnae while maximizing potential in both personal and professional lives.[/stm_text_box][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1455265993559{margin-bottom: 26px !important;}"]The balance Secondary School maintains between honoring the past and remaining committed to the future is one of its most compelling attributes. We hope you'll stay in touch, join our network, and bolster our community by supporting Secondary School students today.[/vc_column_text][stm_social_networks][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row css=".vc_custom_1456657982056{margin-bottom: 96px !important;padding-top: 38px !important;background-position: 0 0 !important;background-repeat: no-repeat !important;}"][vc_column][stm_title title_tag="h2" title_align="center" subtitle_color="dark-gray" sep_color="green" title="Discover our School" sep_enable="true" subtitle_enable="true" subtitle_margin_b="53px"]Our School is an independent day school set in beautiful grounds at Sommerson Bay, some three miles south of the City of California.[/stm_title][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/2" offset="vc_col-lg-4 vc_col-md-4 vc_col-xs-12"][stm_action_box img_id="3270" title="Extra Curricular" action_box_link="url:%23||"][stm_spacing sm_spacing="30px" xs_spacing="30px"][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/2" offset="vc_col-lg-4 vc_col-md-4 vc_col-xs-12"][stm_action_box img_id="3270" title="School Prospectus" action_box_link="url:%23||"][stm_spacing sm_spacing="30px" xs_spacing="30px"][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/2" offset="vc_col-lg-4 vc_col-md-4 vc_col-xs-12"][stm_action_box img_id="3270" title="School Broadsheet" action_box_link="url:%23||"][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][/vc_column][/vc_row]

item.title: Preparing to Christmas
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]The Workshop focused on Dr. Templetons The Jareks, adapted by Edward Ford and brought to the stage by Nathan Xavier. We are home to 1,500 students (aged 12 to 16) and 100 expert faculty and staff a community representing over 40 different nations. We are proud of our international and multi-cultural ethos, and the way our community collaborates to make a difference. Our world-renowned curriculum is built on the best of global and US standards.[/vc_column_text][stm_slider css=".vc_custom_1454049893799{margin-bottom: 32px !important;}"][stm_slider_item item_type="video" poster_id="816" video_link="https://www.youtube.com/embed/C0DPdy98e4c" video_img_id="3270"][stm_slider_item img_id="3270"][stm_slider_item img_id="3270"][/stm_slider][vc_column_text]Our talented musicians recently delighted family, friends and teachers with a range of seasonal concerts. Our Secondary School recital saw students, including the Jazz Band and High School Singers, perform various Christmas numbers to a full theatre, including Silent Night, Here comes Santa Claus and a very jazzy Jingle Bells. Wearing festive costumes for an extravaganza of performances, a second concert of Holiday Pops saw musicians from across the school don reindeer antlers, elf hats and tinsel![/vc_column_text][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner width="5/12"][stm_blockquote blockquote_view_style="bordered" cite="Ms. Emilia Kingsley, Head of Music" css=".vc_custom_1456468594608{margin-top: 11px !important;}"]These two fantastic events are always a highlight of our festive calendar. Our students performed brilliantly and we hope the audiences enjoyed the recitals, as well as our festive efforts![/stm_blockquote][stm_spacing xs_spacing="46px"][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="7/12"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1453977112139{margin-top: -6px !important;margin-bottom: 26px !important;}"]

DUCK week at Lower School!

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]The multi-group recital included jolly renditions from the Lower School and Middle School choirs, the Gong Gang, Marimbas, Ukestra, and the Jazz Couriers. Our wonderful Lower School students were recently visited by three charity representatives after they raised over 1,500 for charitable causes. As part of their annual DUCK week (Developing, Understanding, Caring and Kindness), each year group decided on a different fundraising method, organising activities from discos and games, to face painting and volunteering.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1454040396815{margin-bottom: 54px !important;}"]SPARKS, a childrens medical research charity; and the Donald Sutherland Wildlife Foundation as their chosen charities. Following the students fundraising, representatives from each charity attended a specially planned assembly to talk about their charities and how the funds raised would help support their causes.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row]
item.excerpt:encoded: Considering a private elementary school for your child? Del Mar Pines School is one of the best.

item.title: Drawing and Painting Lessons
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]The Workshop focused on Dr. Templetons The Jareks, adapted by Edward Ford and brought to the stage by Nathan Xavier. We are home to 1,500 students (aged 12 to 16) and 100 expert faculty and staff a community representing over 40 different nations. We are proud of our international and multi-cultural ethos, and the way our community collaborates to make a difference. Our world-renowned curriculum is built on the best of global and US standards.[/vc_column_text][stm_slider css=".vc_custom_1454049893799{margin-bottom: 32px !important;}"][stm_slider_item img_id="3270"][stm_slider_item img_id="3270"][stm_slider_item img_id="3270"][/stm_slider][vc_column_text]Our talented musicians recently delighted family, friends and teachers with a range of seasonal concerts. Our Secondary School recital saw students, including the Jazz Band and High School Singers, perform various Christmas numbers to a full theatre, including Silent Night, Here comes Santa Claus and a very jazzy Jingle Bells. Wearing festive costumes for an extravaganza of performances, a second concert of Holiday Pops saw musicians from across the school don reindeer antlers, elf hats and tinsel![/vc_column_text][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner width="5/12"][stm_blockquote blockquote_view_style="bordered" cite="Ms. Emilia Kingsley, Head of Music" css=".vc_custom_1456380700577{margin-top: 11px !important;}"]These two fantastic events are always a highlight of our festive calendar. Our students performed brilliantly and we hope the audiences enjoyed the recitals, as well as our festive efforts![/stm_blockquote][stm_spacing xs_spacing="46px"][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="7/12"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1453977112139{margin-top: -6px !important;margin-bottom: 26px !important;}"]

DUCK week at Lower School!

Our wonderful Lower School students were recently visited by three charity representatives after they raised over 1,500 for charitable causes. Following the students fundraising, representatives from each charity attended a specially planned assembly to talk about their charities and how the funds raised would help support their causes.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row]

item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row css=".vc_custom_1459859592495{padding-top: 80px !important;padding-bottom: 60px !important;}"][vc_column offset="vc_col-lg-7 vc_col-md-7 vc_col-xs-12"][stm_slider slider_width="600px"][stm_slider_item img_id="3270" img_size="570x480"][stm_slider_item img_id="3270" img_size="570x480"][/stm_slider][stm_spacing lg_spacing="30px" md_spacing="30px" sm_spacing="45px" xs_spacing="45px"][/vc_column][vc_column offset="vc_col-lg-5 vc_col-md-5 vc_col-xs-12"][stm_title title_tag="h2" sep_color="green" title="Language Immersion Summer Camp" sep_enable="true" sep_margin_b="51px" title_line_height="48px" title_margin_t="-13px"]Register early Camps fill quickly! With enough demand, we will open secondary sections of Popular Camps.[/stm_title][vc_column_text]Register early Camps fill quickly! With enough demand, we will open secondary sections of Popular Camps.[/vc_column_text][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/2"][stm_title title_tag="h4" sep_color="green" title="2016 Camp Dates" sep_enable="true"]Register early Camps fill quickly! With enough demand, we will open secondary sections of Popular Camps.[/stm_title][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1455513885744{margin-bottom: 30px !important;}"]Session 1: 6/20 7/1/16 Session 2: 7/5 7/15/16 (No Camp Monday July 4th) Session 3: 7/18 7/29/16[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/2"][stm_single_image img_id="3270" img_size="200x173" img_responsive_enable="true" css=".vc_custom_1460723717651{margin-top: 52px !important;margin-bottom: 30px !important;}"][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row full_width="stretch_row" css=".vc_custom_1455335752397{padding-top: 45px !important;padding-bottom: 39px !important;background-color: #ffffff !important;}"][vc_column offset="vc_col-lg-7 vc_col-md-6 vc_col-xs-12"][stm_title title_tag="h2" sep_color="green" title="Camp Includes" sep_enable="true"][/stm_title][vc_column_text]
  • Small groups with teachers from around the world
  • Fun outdoor and indoor activities aimed at building language skills (songs, folktales, crafts, games, sports, and more)
  • Cultural performances
  • Ice-cream social
  • Special classes with trained specialists- yoga, sports & games
  • Exciting field days (water balloon toss, relay races, and more)
  • Fun, cultural music and movement classes for all campers! We will offer different opportunities each session last year we learned Taiko Drumming, Kung-Fu Martial Arts, and Latin dance!
  • Field trips for Orange, Purple, Blue and Green camps! Specific information about each field trip will be released one week prior to the start of each camp session.
[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column offset="vc_col-lg-5 vc_col-md-6 vc_col-xs-12"][stm_text_box title_tag="h3" sep_color="custom" title_color="custom" text_color="custom" stm_bg_color="green" bg_color="green" title="Camp at a Glance" sep_enable="true" sep_color_custom="#ffffff" text_color_custom="#ffffff" padding_top="39px" padding_right="50px" padding_bottom="44px" padding_left="50px" title_color_custom="#ffffff"]
  1. Choose a language (Spanish, Chinese or Japanese)
  2. Choose a section appropriate for your childs age and fluency level (see chart below)
  3. Choose the two-week session(s) you'd like to attend. All camp sections are available every session in Spanish, Chinese & Japanese
New exciting themes and activities every session. Have fun in one session or all three![/stm_text_box][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row css=".vc_custom_1455779313595{padding-top: 38px !important;padding-bottom: 108px !important;}"][vc_column][stm_title title_tag="h2" sep_color="green" title="Popular Camps" sep_enable="true"][/stm_title][vc_row_inner css=".vc_custom_1455780457095{padding-bottom: 17px !important;}"][vc_column_inner width="1/2"][vc_column_text]Children will enjoy a world of fun this summer while learning Chinese, Spanish or Japanese. International language and culture will come to life through hands-on projects, stories, songs, games and outdoor fun with our natively-fluent staff.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/2"][vc_column_text]Whether learning a new language or already fluent, campers will love our summer traditions of field days, trips, performances, ice creams, and more! Questions? Contact us at summer@stylemixthemes.com[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][stm_pricing_tables item.content:encoded:
[vc_row][vc_column width="5/12" offset="vc_col-lg-5 vc_col-md-5"][stm_spacing xs_spacing="40px"][stm_single_image img_alignment="right" img_id="3270" img_size="910x483"][/vc_column][vc_column width="7/12" offset="vc_col-lg-7 vc_col-md-7"][stm_spacing xs_spacing="40px" lg_spacing="73px" md_spacing="73px" sm_spacing="73px"][stm_title title_tag="h2" sep_color="green" title="Children Learning Together" sep_enable="true"][/stm_title][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1455185545032{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]From 10 faculty members, 40 students and three fields of study at the time of its founding, Secondary School has grown to more than 1,600 faculty, 35,000 students and over 350 degree programs in 130 academic departments and 80 interdisciplinary research units. One of the most important things we can do for students is not just teach them specific knowledge and skills, but help them match their interests to their career path.[/vc_column_text][stm_spacing xs_spacing="40px"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row full_width="stretch_row" css=".vc_custom_1455192302689{padding-top: 45px !important;padding-bottom: 100px !important;background-color: #ffffff !important;}"][vc_column width="7/12"][stm_image_box title_position="outside" sep_color="green" title="Doing Research at School" img_id="3270" sep_enable="true" title_link="url:%23||" css=".vc_custom_1455734826284{margin-bottom: 40px !important;}"]DoResearch, the website of the Office of the Vice Prosoft and Dean of Research, provides comprehensive information about the research enterprise at Secondary School.
  • DoResearch
  • Research Administration
[/stm_image_box][stm_image_box title_position="outside" sep_color="green" title="Dedicated Research Centers" img_id="3270" sep_enable="true" title_link="url:http%3A%2F%2Fsmartyschool.stylemixthemes.com%2Fcourse-schedule%2F||" css=".vc_custom_1455734874232{margin-bottom: 40px !important;}"]Several independent labs, centers and institutes engage faculty and students from across the school. Academic departments sponsor numerous other research labs.
  • Independent Laboratories, Centers and Institutes
  • Research Centers (A Z)
[/stm_image_box][stm_image_box title_position="outside" sep_color="green" title="Integrated Research & Teaching" img_id="3270" sep_enable="true" title_link="url:http%3A%2F%2Fsmartyschool.stylemixthemes.com%2Fclasses%2F||" css=".vc_custom_1455734913061{margin-bottom: 40px !important;}"]The synthesis of teaching and research is fundamental to School. Much of this faculty-driven research takes place within academic departments and interdisciplinary programs.
  • Schools
  • Academic Departments (A Z)
  • Interdisciplinary Programs
[/stm_image_box][stm_image_box title_position="outside" sep_color="green" title="Library" img_id="3270" sep_enable="true" title_link="url:%23||"]Secondary School is home more than 20 individual libraries, each with a world-class collection of books, journals, films, maps, databases.
  • Secondary School Libraries
  • Online Catalog (SearchWorks)
  • Ask a Librarian
[/stm_image_box][/vc_column][vc_column width="5/12"][stm_text_box title_tag="h3" button_color_scheme="white-secondary" button_position="right" sep_color="custom" title_color="custom" text_color="custom" stm_bg_color="blue" title="School Research at a Glance" sep_enable="true" button_text="Learn more" button_link="url:%23||" sep_color_custom="#ffffff" title_color_custom="#ffffff" text_color_custom="#ffffff" text_margin_b="34px"]

Faculty

  • 2,118 faculty members
  • 21 Nobel laureates
  • 4 Pulitzer Prize winners

The Research Enterprise

  • 5,300 externally sponsored projects
  • $1.33 billion total budget
  • About 2,000 postdoctoral scholars
  • 18 independent labs, centers and institutes

Libraries

  • 9.3 million physical volumes
  • 4 million e-books and audiovisual materials
  • 300,000 rare or special books and 59 million pages of unpublished materials

School Innovation

  • In 201415, Stanford received more than $95 million from 695 licensed technologies.
  • Breakthrough inventions licensed by Stanford span medicine, engineering and the sciences.
  • School entrepreneurs have created an estimated 39,900 companies and 5.4 million jobs since the 1930s.
[/stm_text_box][/vc_column][/vc_row]

item.title: Hello world!
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Welcome to WordPress. This is your first post. Edit or delete it, then start writing!

item.title: High School students share Shakespeare's stage
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]The Workshop focused on Dr. Templetons The Jareks, adapted by Edward Ford and brought to the stage by Nathan Xavier. We are home to 1,500 students (aged 12 to 16) and 100 expert faculty and staff a community representing over 40 different nations. We are proud of our international and multi-cultural ethos, and the way our community collaborates to make a difference. Our world-renowned curriculum is built on the best of global and US standards.[/vc_column_text][stm_slider css=".vc_custom_1454049893799{margin-bottom: 32px !important;}"][stm_slider_item img_id="3270"][stm_slider_item img_id="3270"][stm_slider_item img_id="3270"][/stm_slider][vc_column_text]Our talented musicians recently delighted family, friends and teachers with a range of seasonal concerts. Our Secondary School recital saw students, including the Jazz Band and High School Singers, perform various Christmas numbers to a full theatre, including Silent Night, Here comes Santa Claus and a very jazzy Jingle Bells. Wearing festive costumes for an extravaganza of performances, a second concert of Holiday Pops saw musicians from across the school don reindeer antlers, elf hats and tinsel![/vc_column_text][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner width="5/12"][stm_blockquote blockquote_view_style="bordered" cite="Ms. Emilia Kingsley, Head of Music" css=".vc_custom_1456380700577{margin-top: 11px !important;}"]These two fantastic events are always a highlight of our festive calendar. Our students performed brilliantly and we hope the audiences enjoyed the recitals, as well as our festive efforts![/stm_blockquote][stm_spacing xs_spacing="46px"][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="7/12"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1453977112139{margin-top: -6px !important;margin-bottom: 26px !important;}"]

DUCK week at Lower School!

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]The multi-group recital included jolly renditions from the Lower School and Middle School choirs, the Gong Gang, Marimbas, Ukestra, and the Jazz Couriers. Our wonderful Lower School students were recently visited by three charity representatives after they raised over 1,500 for charitable causes. As part of their annual DUCK week (Developing, Understanding, Caring and Kindness), each year group decided on a different fundraising method, organising activities from discos and games, to face painting and volunteering.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1457039389893{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]SPARKS, a childrens medical research charity; and the Donald Sutherland Wildlife Foundation as their chosen charities. Following the students fundraising, representatives from each charity attended a specially planned assembly to talk about their charities and how the funds raised would help support their causes.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row]
item.excerpt:encoded: Every kindergarten through sixth grade student enjoys a core syllabus of language arts, mathematics, science and social studies.

We are home to 1,500 students (aged 12 to 16) and 100 expert faculty and staff a community representing over 40 different nations. We are proud of our international and multi-cultural ethos, and the way our community collaborates to make a difference. Our world-renowned curriculum is built on the best of global and US standards.[/vc_column_text][stm_slider css=".vc_custom_1454049893799{margin-bottom: 32px !important;}"][stm_slider_item item_type="video" poster_id="816" video_link="https://www.youtube.com/embed/C0DPdy98e4c" video_img_id="3270"][stm_slider_item img_id="3270"][stm_slider_item img_id="3270"][/stm_slider][vc_column_text]Our talented musicians recently delighted family, friends and teachers with a range of seasonal concerts. Our Secondary School recital saw students, including the Jazz Band and High School Singers, perform various Christmas numbers to a full theatre, including Silent Night, Here comes Santa Claus and a very jazzy Jingle Bells. Wearing festive costumes for an extravaganza of performances, a second concert of Holiday Pops saw musicians from across the school don reindeer antlers, elf hats and tinsel![/vc_column_text][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner width="5/12"][stm_blockquote blockquote_view_style="bordered" cite="Ms. Emilia Kingsley, Head of Music" css=".vc_custom_1456468594608{margin-top: 11px !important;}"]These two fantastic events are always a highlight of our festive calendar. Our students performed brilliantly and we hope the audiences enjoyed the recitals, as well as our festive efforts![/stm_blockquote][stm_spacing xs_spacing="46px"][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="7/12"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1453977112139{margin-top: -6px !important;margin-bottom: 26px !important;}"]

DUCK week at Lower School!

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]The multi-group recital included jolly renditions from the Lower School and Middle School choirs, the Gong Gang, Marimbas, Ukestra, and the Jazz Couriers. Our wonderful Lower School students were recently visited by three charity representatives after they raised over 1,500 for charitable causes. As part of their annual DUCK week (Developing, Understanding, Caring and Kindness), each year group decided on a different fundraising method, organising activities from discos and games, to face painting and volunteering.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1454040396815{margin-bottom: 54px !important;}"]SPARKS, a childrens medical research charity; and the Donald Sutherland Wildlife Foundation as their chosen charities. Following the students fundraising, representatives from each charity attended a specially planned assembly to talk about their charities and how the funds raised would help support their causes.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row]
item.excerpt:encoded: The Workshop focused on Dr. Templetons The Jareks, adapted by Edward Ford and brought to the stage by Nathan Xavier.

item.title: A social event of Pasta & Prosecco
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]Discussion and community dialogue with school staff, parents and community members in the Secondary School area: Forester, Hewlett, Lancaster, Longwood/Sutherland, Sunderland and Whiteman primary schools; CPMA and Innovation middle schools; Mt. Etherman Academy; Moer L-11; Monterey Primary School. Meeting of the trustees of the Secondary School. Open to the public.[/vc_column_text][stm_google_map map_coordinates="event" height="460px" css=".vc_custom_1456662114266{margin-bottom: 35px !important;}"][vc_column_text]Parents, students and community members are invited to attend this meeting, which discusses educational issues at the high school and its middle and elementary schools. Schools in the Kerrington cluster are: Aldiger, Caramba, Chesterfield, Cutterey, Fraiser, Johnson, Antonio, Lorney Winston, Ramos, and Westford secondary schools; Monterey and Tilt middle schools; and Kearrrinfton High. All schools and district offices are closed for Martin Luther King Jr. Day. Year-round schools resume school. Open to the public.[/vc_column_text][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner width="5/12"][stm_blockquote blockquote_view_style="bordered" cite="Mr. Clayton Thornton, a Libby Award winner" css=".vc_custom_1456469026322{margin-top: 11px !important;}"]The Clairemont High School junior received the honor from the youth division of the international animal rights organization People for the Ethical Treatment of Animals (PETA).[/stm_blockquote][stm_spacing sm_spacing="30px" xs_spacing="30px"][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="7/12"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1454331491529{margin-top: -6px !important;margin-bottom: 26px !important;}"]

Eligibility

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]The multi-group recital included jolly renditions from the Lower School and Middle School choirs, the Gong Gang, Marimbas, Ukestra, and the Jazz Couriers. Our wonderful Lower School students were recently visited by three charity representatives after they raised over 1,500 for charitable causes. As part of their annual DUCK week (Developing, Understanding, Caring and Kindness), each year group decided on a different fundraising method, organising activities from discos and games, to face painting and volunteering.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text]Healthy Schools. Bale was saluted for his successes in giving Secondary School "a shared vision for student and staff wellness, in large part because of Michael Bales dedication and efforts to promote wellness," according to the provider's website.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row]
item.excerpt:encoded: The school PTFA would like to invite you to enjoy an evening of Pasta and Prosecco in November.

item.title: School Lunch Program More than me
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]

Profile

The More Than Me Academy is on a mission to ensure that education and opportunity, not exploitation and poverty, define the lives of the most vulnerable girls from the West Point slum of Liberia. When girls graduate, they should be able to decide what comes next. A boarding school is More Than Me' s ultimate vision for the girls because a boarding school eliminates the time spent at risk in the West Point community. To that end, More Than Me was founded with the hope of getting the girls off the streets and into school. Getting girls off the street is important because, according to GirlUp, more than 40% of Liberian girls ages 1014 have never gone to school.[/vc_column_text][stm_slider css=".vc_custom_1454049893799{margin-bottom: 32px !important;}"][stm_slider_item item_type="video" poster_id="816" video_link="https://www.youtube.com/embed/C0DPdy98e4c" video_img_id="3270"][stm_slider_item img_id="3270"][stm_slider_item img_id="3270"][/stm_slider][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner width="5/12"][stm_blockquote blockquote_view_style="bordered" cite="Balaji Sampath, Secretary-CEO" css=".vc_custom_1456470154451{margin-top: 11px !important;}"]AID INDIA is a non-profit organization, founded in 1996, by a group of IIT and BITS alumni who quit corporate careers to work on various development initiatives like donations.[/stm_blockquote][stm_spacing xs_spacing="35px"][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="7/12"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1453977112139{margin-top: -6px !important;margin-bottom: 26px !important;}"]

DUCK week at Lower School!

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]The multi-group recital included jolly renditions from the Lower School and Middle School choirs, the Gong Gang, Marimbas, Ukestra, and the Jazz Couriers. Our wonderful Lower School students were recently visited by three charity representatives after they raised over 1,500 for charitable causes. As part of their annual DUCK week (Developing, Understanding, Caring and Kindness), each year group decided on a different fundraising method, organising activities from discos and games, to face painting and volunteering. - See more at: http://smartyschool.stylemixthemes.com/we-are-at-independent-schools-show/#sthash.4IsWlllT.dpuf[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/2"][vc_column_text]

History

73% of Liberian children are denied an education; over 80% of them are girls. A girl denied an education, is a girl on the street; it's a girl who's exploited and condemned to underemployment. The ripple effect of this denial of her basic right is seen in the stagnation of her wages, her susceptibility to exploitation and disease, and even her children's future education.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/2"][vc_column_text]

Impact

Educating one girl can change everything. An extra year of primary school boosts girls' eventual wages by 10 to 20%. An extra year of secondary school: 15 to 25%. When women and girls earn income, they reinvest 90% of it into their families. When we invest in girls, we all win. Our goal is that every girl at MTM will be able to make choice for her life.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][/vc_column][/vc_row]

item.title: Algebra 1
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: [vc_row css=".vc_custom_1459860994827{margin-bottom: 100px !important;padding-top: 80px !important;}"][vc_column offset="vc_col-lg-7 vc_col-md-7"][vc_row_inner css=".vc_custom_1455017938386{margin-bottom: 37px !important;}"][vc_column_inner width="1/4" offset="vc_col-lg-3 vc_col-md-3 vc_col-xs-12"][stm_course_teacher_bio css=".vc_custom_1455017911073{margin-bottom: 30px !important;}"][stm_spacing xs_spacing="30px"][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="3/4" offset="vc_col-lg-9 vc_col-md-9 vc_col-xs-12"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1455017932085{margin-bottom: 30px !important;}"]I know you are wondering if this program will cover the units that you are studying. Below is a list of all the units and the lessons contained in the units. If you are using this as a curriculum, you can see that this Algebra Course contains a very thorough study of Algebra. item.title: Setup New Football Stadium
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]

Profile

The More Than Me Academy is on a mission to ensure that education and opportunity, not exploitation and poverty, define the lives of the most vulnerable girls from the West Point slum of Liberia. When girls graduate, they should be able to decide what comes next. A boarding school is More Than Me' s ultimate vision for the girls because a boarding school eliminates the time spent at risk in the West Point community. To that end, More Than Me was founded with the hope of getting the girls off the streets and into school. Getting girls off the street is important because, according to GirlUp, more than 40% of Liberian girls ages 1014 have never gone to school.[/vc_column_text][stm_slider css=".vc_custom_1454049893799{margin-bottom: 32px !important;}"][stm_slider_item item_type="video" poster_id="816" video_link="https://www.youtube.com/embed/C0DPdy98e4c" video_img_id="3270"][stm_slider_item img_id="3270"][stm_slider_item img_id="3270"][/stm_slider][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner width="5/12"][stm_blockquote blockquote_view_style="bordered" cite="Balaji Sampath, Secretary-CEO" css=".vc_custom_1456470154451{margin-top: 11px !important;}"]AID INDIA is a non-profit organization, founded in 1996, by a group of IIT and BITS alumni who quit corporate careers to work on various development initiatives like donations.[/stm_blockquote][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="7/12"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1453977112139{margin-top: -6px !important;margin-bottom: 26px !important;}"]

DUCK week at Lower School!

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]The multi-group recital included jolly renditions from the Lower School and Middle School choirs, the Gong Gang, Marimbas, Ukestra, and the Jazz Couriers. Our wonderful Lower School students were recently visited by three charity representatives after they raised over 1,500 for charitable causes. As part of their annual DUCK week (Developing, Understanding, Caring and Kindness), each year group decided on a different fundraising method, organising activities from discos and games, to face painting and volunteering.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/2"][vc_column_text]

History

73% of Liberian children are denied an education; over 80% of them are girls. A girl denied an education, is a girl on the street; it's a girl who's exploited and condemned to underemployment. The ripple effect of this denial of her basic right is seen in the stagnation of her wages, her susceptibility to exploitation and disease, and even her children's future education.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/2"][vc_column_text]

Impact

Educating one girl can change everything. An extra year of primary school boosts girls' eventual wages by 10 to 20%. An extra year of secondary school: 15 to 25%. When women and girls earn income, they reinvest 90% of it into their families. When we invest in girls, we all win. Our goal is that every girl at MTM will be able to make choice for her life.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][/vc_column][/vc_row]

item.title: Henry Cluster Council
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]Discussion and community dialogue with school staff, parents and community members in the Secondary School area: Forester, Hewlett, Lancaster, Longwood/Sutherland, Sunderland and Whiteman primary schools; CPMA and Innovation middle schools; Mt. Etherman Academy; Moer L-11; Monterey Primary School. Meeting of the trustees of the Secondary School. Open to the public.[/vc_column_text][stm_google_map map_coordinates="event" height="460px" css=".vc_custom_1456662114266{margin-bottom: 35px !important;}"][vc_column_text]Parents, students and community members are invited to attend this meeting, which discusses educational issues at the high school and its middle and elementary schools. Schools in the Kerrington cluster are: Aldiger, Caramba, Chesterfield, Cutterey, Fraiser, Johnson, Antonio, Lorney Winston, Ramos, and Westford secondary schools; Monterey and Tilt middle schools; and Kearrrinfton High. All schools and district offices are closed for Martin Luther King Jr. Day. Year-round schools resume school. Open to the public.[/vc_column_text][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner width="5/12"][stm_blockquote blockquote_view_style="bordered" cite="Mr. Clayton Thornton, a Libby Award winner" css=".vc_custom_1456469026322{margin-top: 11px !important;}"]The Clairemont High School junior received the honor from the youth division of the international animal rights organization People for the Ethical Treatment of Animals (PETA).[/stm_blockquote][stm_spacing sm_spacing="30px" xs_spacing="30px"][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="7/12"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1454331491529{margin-top: -6px !important;margin-bottom: 26px !important;}"]

Eligibility

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]The multi-group recital included jolly renditions from the Lower School and Middle School choirs, the Gong Gang, Marimbas, Ukestra, and the Jazz Couriers. Our wonderful Lower School students were recently visited by three charity representatives after they raised over 1,500 for charitable causes. As part of their annual DUCK week (Developing, Understanding, Caring and Kindness), each year group decided on a different fundraising method, organising activities from discos and games, to face painting and volunteering.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text]Healthy Schools. Bale was saluted for his successes in giving Secondary School "a shared vision for student and staff wellness, in large part because of Michael Bales dedication and efforts to promote wellness," according to the provider's website.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row]
item.excerpt:encoded: Discussion and community dialogue with school staff, parents and community members.

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]The multi-group recital included jolly renditions from the Lower School and Middle School choirs, the Gong Gang, Marimbas, Ukestra, and the Jazz Couriers. Our wonderful Lower School students were recently visited by three charity representatives after they raised over 1,500 for charitable causes. As part of their annual DUCK week (Developing, Understanding, Caring and Kindness), each year group decided on a different fundraising method, organising activities from discos and games, to face painting and volunteering.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text]Healthy Schools. Bale was saluted for his successes in giving Secondary School "a shared vision for student and staff wellness, in large part because of Michael Bales dedication and efforts to promote wellness," according to the provider's website.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row]

item.title: The Long Run: The Impact of Brain Injuries on the NFL | Secondary School
item.dc:creator: admin

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Though players are well-compensated, many wonder about the long-term cost of those violent collisions on the athletes, the league, and culture at large. School Professor Timothy Gillenhaal discusses those implications.

item.title: Sven Bender, CEO at UberCars
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: A sound-field system makes it easier for the students to hear the teachers voice. Research has found that sound-field systems may improve literacy development in all children.

item.title: Maria Bimmer, Manager at WallMarkt
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: All classrooms are equipped with a sound-field system for the benefit of the hearing as well as the children with hearing loss.

item.title: Luisa Silverstone, Lead Engineer at AudioCloud
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: While I love School's emphasis on a diverse liberal arts education, during my sophomore year I found myself wondering how I could fuse my plethora of academic interests into a unified skill-set.

item.title: Amanda Elliott

item.content:encoded:
[vc_row full_width="stretch_row" css=".vc_custom_1455950270795{padding-top: 45px !important;padding-bottom: 80px !important;background-color: #ffffff !important;}"][vc_column width="5/12"][stm_single_image img_id="3270" img_size="525x360" img_responsive_enable="true"][/vc_column][vc_column width="7/12"][stm_title title_tag="h2" subtitle_color="dark-gray" page_title_enable="true" sep_enable="true" subtitle_enable="true" subtitle_font_size="16px" subtitle_margin_b="0px"]Ms Amanda Eliot is a member of the National Academy of Engineering and a Fellow of the American Institute of Aeronautics and Astronautics, the American Society for Engineering Education, and the American Society of Mechanical Engineers.
